page.title: 17Transport in the Wolfords
page.content: Public transport in rural England is almost non existent. Almost every household has a car with about half owning two or more cars. But there is a small number, mainly elderly, who have no car and a further number who have no use of a car during working hours. There is a bus through Great Wolford and Todenham each day except Sunday to either Moreton in Marsh, Stratford or Banbury. Little Wolford has only one bus per week to Moreton Market, and two a day to Stratford or Oxford from half a mile away. The area is served by voluntary car schemes, where by volunteers give lifts with some contribution towards their costs. This transport is available for necessary journeys such as visits to hospitals, doctors. The nearest railway station is in Moreton.
